column5: In the words of Noel Coward, " only mad dogs and Englishmen go out in the mid day sun". And I'm not English Hit some high afternoon bassin after physio today, seeing as the lake was just around the corner. Was it ever hot out there, but the fish were biting and hitting senkos hard. A few samples.   Even the perch wanted senkos. Hook went straight through his head. Dead instantly.  After 2 1/2 hours I had enough. Back home to the A/C and cold beer.
that first fish looks cleeeeeeeeeeeeeen....nice shootin
Good going Bruce     I'd say that's a well spent couple of hours.... nice bass too Jacques
Good job! I wanted to hit the river but the heat was killing me

i hit a little trib in London this afternoon... fished out of the sun under a bridge,,,, used my light action rod and a very small jig and grubbie...  LOT's of rock bass and one 1/2 smallie.... even under the bridge was toooo hot.... but the fishies wouldn;t let me leave
Sounds like two hours well spent. When fishing a shallow body of water, fish turn on in this heat. If the water is deep they head for the depths.
Was fishing a 12' deep break with the senkos. They were sitting at the bottom of it.
Nice smallies but is that a uglystik   and a white bucket
The same Uglystick I've bin using for 12 years. As for the bucket.A) What contingency should I have for a damaged fish? I like my fresh dinners
LOL I have the exact same rod thats how I knew it was a uglystick just being a smart
